info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 02 at 2:21PM MST until February 03 at 12:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Blowing and drifting snow. Winds gusting as high as 65 mph, with visibility to as low as one quarter of a mile. * WHERE...The Rocky Mountain Front. * WHEN...Until Noon MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility, and drifting snow could lead to partial lane blockages. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday evening and Thursday morning commutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website. To see a graphical representation of the degree of stress on young livestock please visit our webpage and select Local Programs then Cold Air Advisory for Newborn Livestock.
